paper_metadata.title: Genotype-Phenotype Correlation of a Rare Transthyretin Variant Causing Amyloidosis
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.239C>T;p.Thr80Ile, including clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.phenotype: mixed phenotype of cardiac amyloidosis, sensorimotor polyneuropathy, and bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.phenotype_details: left ventricular hypertrophy, neuropathy, and symptoms of heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We present a case of LVH and severe HF from amyloidosis with cardiac, neurologic, and soft tissue involvement, supported by clinical, laboratory, imaging, and pathology data typical for ATTR.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a mixed phenotype of cardiac amyloidosis and neuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in 2 subjects in a regional study, with one affected and one unaffected.
variants.population_frequency: 0.00007191 in a study of 13,906 unrelated Saudi Arabian individuals
variants.additional_notes: The variant previously had limited phenotypic characterization and lacked functional data.
key_quotes: The c.239C>T;p.Thr80Ile TTR variant is associated with a mixed phenotype of cardiac amyloidosis, sensorimotor polyneuropathy, and bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome.
This variant previously had incomplete phenotypic characterization in public databases, and this case enriches the clinical data to support its pathogenicity.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
